meanings.definition: A person who tests or evaluates something for errors or quality.
meanings.sent1: The proofer carefully checked the document for any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The proofer at the bakery inspects the cakes before they are sold.
meanings.sent3: The proofer found a funny typo in the report and couldn't stop laughing.
meanings.sent4: She was a proofer of emotions, always able to detect hidden feelings.
meanings.sent5: The proofer's keen eye caught even the smallest errors in the design.

meanings.definition: A device used to control the temperature and humidity of a room for proofing dough.
meanings.sent1: The baker adjusted the settings on the proofer to help the dough rise.
meanings.sent2: The proofer maintained the ideal conditions for fermenting the bread.
meanings.sent3: The proofer beeped loudly when the dough was ready, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The proofer hummed like a contented cat as it worked its magic on the dough.
meanings.sent5: The warm glow of the proofer enveloped the kitchen, signaling delicious bread ahead.

meanings.definition: A substance applied to a surface to make it resistant to water or stains.
meanings.sent1: The proofer spray protected the shoes from getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent2: She used a proofer on the fabric to prevent spills from staining it.
meanings.sent3: The proofer lotion made the leather jacket look shiny and new.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a proofer, repelling any negativity that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The proofer created an invisible shield, keeping the surface pristine and clean.
